poem:
**Resolution in Waiting**

In Gaza's tender grasp  
quivering papers rest—  
between ink and intention,  
a peace yet unopened.  
Sand whispers secrets  
to fractured skies;  
stillness, an ephemeral plea.  
Hope teeters—  
on tongues of diplomats.  
On maps,  
lines draw the breath of tomorrow  
(if at all)  
amidst the heart's restless  
pause.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UN resolution on international stabilisation force for Gaza could be ready within two weeks A UN security council resolution mandating the introduction of an international stabilisation force into Gaza is likely to be ready within two weeks, but may be delayed if disputes cannot be resolved over the force’s mandate, including the question of US military leadership, its relationship with the Palestinian civil police force and a timetable for Israeli military withdrawal. At a meeting". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
